listitem.para: Command that must be used within the scope of a CATCH instruction that has a tag equal to tag. THROW ends the running of the CATCH instruction's instruction list parameter. If THROW is not given a value parameter, then the corresponding CATCH does not output a value. If THROW is given a value parameter, then CATCH outputs value.
The tag parameter must be a word.
THROW "TOPLEVEL can be used to terminate all running procedures and interactive pauses, and return to the toplevel instruction prompt. This has the same effect as pressing the Halt button.

THROW "ERROR can be used to generate an error condition. If the error is not caught, it prints a message (THROW "ERROR) with the usual indication of where the error (in this case the THROW) occurred. If a value parameter and tag equals "ERROR, then value is used as the text of the error message instead of the standard message. In this case, the location indicated for the error will not be the location of the THROW, but the location where the procedure containing the THROW was invoked. This allows user-defined procedures to generate error messages as if they were primitives. Note: in this case the corresponding CATCH "ERROR, if any, does not output, since the second input to THROW is not considered a return value.
THROW "SYSTEM immediately leaves Logo, returning to the operating system (with exit code 1). In this case, MSWLogo does not delete any temporary file written by EDIT.

listitem.programlisting:
TO MYPROG2 PRINT [Before throw] (THROW "tag1 [We need to get back]) PRINT [We never get here because we THROW back] END
TO MYPROG1 SHOW CATCH "tag1 [MYPROG2] PRINT [I'm back] END
MYPROG1 Before throw [We need to get back] I'm back
